level.text: In evaluating bids or proposals, agencies shall award preferences as follows:
In the case of proposals, points shall be granted as follows:
Three points for a small business enterprise;
Five points for a resident-owned business;
Five points for a longtime resident business;
Two points for a local business enterprise;
Two points for a local business enterprise with its principal office located in an enterprise zone;
Two points for a disadvantaged business enterprise;
Two points for a veteran-owned business enterprise; and
Two points for a local manufacturing business enterprise.
In the case of bids, a percentage reduction in price shall be granted as follows:
Three percent for a small business enterprise;
Five percent for a resident-owned business;
Ten percent for a longtime resident business;
Two percent for a local business enterprise;
Two percent for a local business enterprise with its principal office located in an enterprise zone; and
Two percent for a disadvantaged business enterprise.

A certified business enterprise shall be entitled to any or all of the preferences provided in this section, but in no case shall a certified business enterprise be entitled to a preference of more than 12 points or a reduction in price of more than 12 percent.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-266, in subsec. (a)(1)(B), substituted "Five points" for "Three points"; and, in (a)(2)(B), substituted "Five percent" for "Three percent".
D.C. Law 17-207, in pars. (1)(B) and (2)(B), inserted "a" preceding "resident-owned".

D.C. Law 18-141, in subsec. (a)(1), substituted "Five points" for "Ten points" in subpar. (C), deleted "and" from the end of subpar. (E); substituted "; and" for a period at the end of subpar. (F), and added subpars. (G) and (H).
D.C. Law 19-171 repealed subsection (h)(3) of D.C. Law 18-141 that substituted "; and" for a period at the end of subpar. (a)(1)(F).
